website_summaries.verdict: Built-in WiFi and fast graphics processor give this model a quick refresh rate, making it a nice choice for online gaming.
pros: Contains multiple pre-loaded apps, which simplifies using the smart TV features
Contains 4K resolution, and it upscales HD programming nicely to take advantage of its 4K capabilities
Uses full-array LED backlighting for uniform screen quality
cons: Price is a little higher than some other 55-inch TVs
Longevity of this model is questionable

website_summaries.verdict: Vizio's Du series offers surprisingly good performance at a reasonable price, making it a good option if you're in the market for your first 4K television.
cons: Clunky menu system and connected features

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Item was defective. The top right corner blinks when the tv is powered on. Seller not communicating regarding a return...
customer_reviews.author: lboha009

customer_reviews.title: Great price Good TV
customer_reviews.text: works well so far. Will need something to test the 4K capability. I don't have enough Internet bandwidth to get more than a minute of 4k. Does a great job of showing HD or regular TV on the screen. Sound is much better when mounted on the wall than on a table.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Not a good TV
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1 hour and quit. A real lemon of a TV. I bought a Sharp from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition and we thought it was a great price ...
customer_reviews.text: Hubster has been loving this TV. Arrived in perfect condition and we thought it was a great price the day we got it
customer_reviews.author: Kl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected and a bit more. My first "Smart" tv.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome TV, admittedly I only have it running for ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome TV, admittedly I only have it running for a couple hours but it gather many more stations from the air waves than my old TV did, and it is very crispy, I don't know about 4K, I don't have a driver for that, yet.
customer_reviews.author: rejedejo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No doubt that the receiver will be jumping for joy. It is a gift
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Great TV for the price. Got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice but.....I'm you can find onewith better Picture Quality (LG)
customer_reviews.text: The television only gets 3 stars due to the following: It doesn't have a built in streaming hardware/software radio; such as Bluetooth The television doesn't support 3D technologies 4K Resolution not REALLY noticeable with the 120Hz Motion rate. 240Hz would have benefitted better quality. Your television will need to be programmed by a professional to get the ride "Picture Mode" for your environment. Can be costly$$$
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent purchase! This Vizio television has an awesome picture and easy to assemble and setup. My wife and I are enjoying it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Will not last (update on repair)
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Vizio said the repair would cost more for them than the TV is worth. I order a kit from shopjimmy.com for about $99 (with taxes and shipping) which contained all the boards for the TV. I replaced each board one at a time and found the main board was bad. I now have a working TV for a lot less than a new one. This TV lasted 3 years 4 months before the screen went black. Paid $760 for this junk. Vizio support said that it would be to expensive to repair. I had a Samsung that last 10 years. No more Vizio products.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abbotson

customer_reviews.title: Worst TV I’ve ever owned. I have owned 3 Vizio TVs but will not buy any more after this one.
customer_reviews.text: The picture freezes at times, leaving you with only sound. The only way to correct it is to unplug the tv and plug it back in. The tv will randomly reset itself at times, which is also very annoying. The worst thing is it takes a miracle to get Hulu going on it. There’s always a network error that’s popping up, or the video will start buffering mid way through. I can assure you it’s not my internet. I have gigabit fiber and the tv is plugged in direct. This tv is a piece of garbage and Vizio should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.author: Deadcell

customer_reviews.title: Vizio makes "Disposable TVs"
customer_reviews.text: Remote connectivity is worse than my first TV I bought in the 80s I'm not kidding. Also these TV's are "disposable" as in Vizio claims they are not repairable and they break usually after a year when the warranty is up. Google "Vizio disposable televisions" they have class action lawsuits against them for k a owingly selling garbage. Buy ANYTHING ELSE my regret still hurts to this day.
customer_reviews.author: jeffyk

customer_reviews.title: Ps4 beware
customer_reviews.text: I actually really likes this tv, but a recent firmware update made it so my PS4 pro is unable to be used through the 4K port. So I have a 4K tv that's unable to play 4K. This is a well known problem that the company doesn't seem to care to fix. Instead, the last update added a option to send information about what I watch back to them. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bova

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: After six months my VIZIO turns on sometimes and sometimes it does not. Tried two remotes with same results. Press ON and power light comes on for about five seconds then turns off. Forget the one year WARRANTY which requires you to ship the tv to them. DO NOT BUY VIZIO.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for buck by far
customer_reviews.text: Best Bang for buck by far. I wanted a more expensive samsung in the same size but the majority of the reviews were of blue spot issues so I looked to an even more expensive Sony unit, those had even worse issues with backlighting. I ended up settling with this after going to walmart and playing with it in person, no regrets what so ever! Be careful of the base leg width if your not mounting on the wall though, its got a wide stance.
customer_reviews.author: JCoats

customer_reviews.title: Edge Bleed Problems!! (Original and Replacement)
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to be a decent TV. But, my TV developed edge bleed within the first two months. I got a replacement and it developed the same problem within the first two months. There seems to be a severe lack of quality control with this TV. I asked if I could a different model (even offered to pay for the difference), but Customer Service told me that it could not be possible and can only send me a replacement TV. I am hoping third time's a charm or I am stuck with a bad quality product for a long time. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Vishnu P.

customer_reviews.title: Backlight reflectors
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS TV. VISIO DOES NOT BACK ITS PRODUCT. I have this tv for about two years and now I have 3 white circle spots in the picture it's apparently from these BACK light reflectors that are cheaply glued on Visio says I'm out of warranty and wants to know nothing. Bad company, bad product !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget 4k smart tv.
customer_reviews.text: Very good 4k TV. I could find no info on this TV as it relates to the vizio M series. From what I can tell it's mainly the lack of a qwerty keyboard on the back of the remote and all black design with no silver bezel. Smart tv functions great, in depth adjustments, 4k 60hz gaming input with low latency. I've been watching for a couple of weeks now and am very happy with this TV. Black levels are great with detail. For the price of 700 you can't go wrong. Half what I paid for the lg it replaced after all the inputs died.
customer_reviews.author: Zeppelinator

customer_reviews.title: Get it without wifi and add a 4K Roku only $398
customer_reviews.text: I was able to buy this without the built in Wi-Fi for $398. They add $200 to $300 just for Wi-Fi. So I added my 4K Roku and can't beat the picture. The sound I use a sound system but I give a 3 for sound and remote I have is horrible but for a 55 inch 4K with 120 refresh rate at $398 can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: The Mind Enhancer

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Quality
customer_reviews.text: After having several Vizio products from early in the company's life, we've been very let down by there more recent offerings. As Vizio has become more popular, the quality has sharply declined (in our experience). We still have 2 tv's from the mid to late 2000's going strong, but both tv's from the past 5 years died in between 1-2 years of use (outside of warranty). Will never be buying Vizio again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TV turns off by itself
customer_reviews.text: This TV worked fine for 6 months. Now it will turn off by itself. It's periodic but is getting more frequent. I had my last flat screen for 10 years and it still worked great when I gave it away for this one. Will not be purchasing a Vizio again.
customer_reviews.author: Ayanna

customer_reviews.title: VIZIO > Samsung / LG
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stunning clarity and resolution!! I was hesitant to buy it since it's the step down from the M-Series, however, as another person stated, it's really only just the keyboard on the remote and the silver accent on the TV. This TV works phenomonally with my PS4 and shows detail I have never seen before. HD and 4K look 3D, best quality I have honestly ever seen from a TV. Works perfectly with my 40" VIZIO Sound Bar, as well... Amazing TV for the price and I couldn't be happier with this purchase. VIZIO is a top brand and in my opinion the best!!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Affronti

customer_reviews.title: Do not think you are getting a deal. Save your money for something better!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this television. If you watch sports or cable/satellite tv, this is NOT the television for you. The images are extremely blurry, and this tv can not handle motion at all. HD looks almost as bad as standard def. 1080i is very bad, because this tv doesn't handle interlacing well. One week after purchase the tv became worse, and even movies and general text on the screen became blurry. This tv is cheap for a reason. I had to return it. You are better off saving the extra money for a more stable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Visio 55 inch UHD
customer_reviews.text: Bought at Wal-Mart; priced comparable to Amazon. I'm disappointed mine seems so dark. The speakers are on the back, making it difficult to hear unless there is something to reflect sound forward. We are using it as a type of room divider, and cannot hear it from the front well. Otherwise, nice price, easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Colette West

customer_reviews.title: Decent picture but it has frozen up at least a ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent picture but it has frozen up at least a dozen times in the last 6 months and I have had it break twice. On my third TV now.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Vizio TV about a year and a half ago has been working great now I have a green green lines granny back around TV is the tear rating horrible it's barely a year and a half and I'm going to throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: The smart features only work with Visio remote and they break ...
customer_reviews.text: Only buy this TV if you can afford to buy a new remote every month. The smart features only work with Visio remote and they break only from fall off the arm of a chair. I’ve bought 8 new remotes in 12 months. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbibis

customer_reviews.title: Not For Youtube
customer_reviews.text: The display is great, it's massive, there are barely any apps and IT DOES NOT SUPPORT VP9. That means you'll be limited to 1080p when you use the Youtube application, something I would have only expected from the M-series. Very upset that this was not listed anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Run away from smartcast.
customer_reviews.text: Run, do not walk to the nearest exit on the smartcast tecchnology. Sometimes it works, but most of the time it doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Reece

customer_reviews.title: Forget watching Prime
customer_reviews.text: Smartcast does not work with Amazon Prime... THIS SHOULD BE ON THE BOX!!!
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good TV for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good TV for the money. Have used it for about a week now with the Vizio 3.1 soundbar. Both pair up great and can be controlled using a directv remote. Picture is better then my Sony 46" LED which was over $1,000 a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: LSUNK

customer_reviews.title: COMPANY TRYING TO INVADE YOUR PRIVACY!!!
customer_reviews.text: A recent Vizio update basically turned on a feature by default to steal your viewing history!! They aren't making enough money selling you a tv so now they are stealing your personal information. If you watch show X, guess what? Now your going to get pushed ads about it.... Watch out! Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Soooo Tired

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Vizio! Always living up to its name!
customer_reviews.text: I hope Vizio has something better in store for 2017 because it's a shame they're not putting more of these out on the market! All I can say is Excellent! I give this TV two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want 120hz
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv hoping to play games on it. On day 1 it was awesome. The motion blur setting made everything look amazing. Turned the tv off and went to bed. Woke up the next morning and turned on my tv. Overnight the tv updated the firmware automatically. Vizio removed the reduce motion blur. Effectively removing the 120hz from this model. So now my tv only works in 60hz with no option to bump it up. I called them about this problem and they told me that they have been aware of this issue since november 2015! They have no timescale of when it will be put back on or if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: 9.5 out of 10 for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this model for close to a year now and can note only one drawback about it, while streaming house of cards via netflix through the TV's app itself as well as through my PS4 through the same TV. Both in 4k the comparison while streaming through the app looks sharp crisp and vivid the ps4 streaming through the TV gives it that's boost of quality so in essence the apps is weak dawg otherwise nice fundamentals
customer_reviews.author: Alonzo Biggins

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I got it at BB for $599 on black Friday weekend to play Xbox one on. 2k16 looks and plays great on it. We're also casting shows with Chromecast on our as well. If recommend the TV. I like the latency control for gaming a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ms 211

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great TV for the price. Bought it from Costco and they included an extra one year warranty. Picture quality is great, remote very easy to use and set up was quick. Definitely recommend this TV
customer_reviews.author: Erin L Roitman

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. All of the Vizio TVs, regardless of series, will develop dark spots and failed backlights within 2 years and Vizio just washes their hands of the rampant issue. TVs should not be considered a one year disposable commodity but that's exactly how Vizio sees them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Armstrong

product_meta.title: VIZIO D55u-D1 55" Class Ultra HD Full-Array LED Smart TV (Black)
product_meta.description:
Introducing the all-new VIZIO D-series Ultra HD Full-Array LED Smart TV. With over 8.3 million pixels in every image, four times the resolution of 1080p Full HD, D-series Ultra HD displays produce breathtaking detail and clarity. Full-Array LED backlighting and 14 Active LED Zones deliver superior light uniformity with an extremely high contrast, and deep, pure black levels. Active Pixel Tuning enables pixel-level brightness adjustments for increased picture accuracy and contrast. And with Clear Action 240, sports and action fans will appreciate the powerful image processing of the D-series with a blazing 120Hz effective refresh rate achieved with backlight scanning for sharper detail in fast action scenes. In addition, the beautifully designed D-series is optimized to deliver all of your favorite entertainment in stunning 4k Ultra HD right out of the box. Thanks to HEVC decoding and ultra-fast 802.11ac dual-band Wi-Fi (up to 3x faster¹), you’ll get Ultra HD streaming from popular apps like Netflix, Amazon Instant Video and UltraFlix². Its powerful Spatial Scaling Engine beautifully transforms your favorite 720p and 1080p HD sports, movies, and TV shows into near Ultra HD. And support for the latest HDMI standards enables Ultra HD playback from next generation cable and satellite receivers, Blu-ray players and game consoles. It all adds up to a beautifully simple experience where the picture is everything and nothing is more captivating!

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Stunning Ultra HD picture - Experience incredible detail and clarity with 8.3 million pixels with 3840 x 2160 UHD
Spatial Scaling Engine - Beautifully transforms 1080p Full HD sports, movies and TV shows to spectacular 4K Ultra HD resolution.
VIZIO Internet Apps Plus - Optimized for Ultra HD streaming, beautifully simple Smart TV delivers instant access to the hottest movies, TV shows, music, and more.
802.11ac dual-band Wi-Fi - Up to 3x faster than 802.11n, perfect for Ultra HD video streaming.
V6 Six-Core Processor - Quad-core GPU and Dual-core CPU for blazing fast performance and faster, smoother Smart TV experience.
Details panel with stand, panel without stand, Width: 48.8 in, 56.6 in, Depth: 10 in, 2.5 in, Height: 28.4 in, 30.7 in, Weight: 36.6 lbs, 37.5 lbs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars122 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
